intro: Tribulus sinaicus, commonly known as the Sinai spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tribulus sinaicus is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, exhibiting features such as reduced leaf surface and deep root systems. It is often found in rocky soils and is considered a resilient species in its native habitat.
